The company also achieved a median two-qubit gate fidelity of 99% on its 108-qubit system.

**Quantum Computing Inc. (QUBT)**
*   **February 3, 2026:** Quantum Computing Inc. filed an 8-K Current Report.
*   **February 2, 2026:** Quantum Computing Inc. completed its acquisition of Luminar Semiconductor, Inc. from Luminar Technologies, Inc. for approximately $97.5 million in cash, plus an $11.0 million escrow.
*   **January 30, 2026:** Luminar Technologies, Inc. filed an amended Chapter 11 plan of liquidation and related disclosure statement, relevant to QUBT's acquisition of Luminar Semiconductor.
*   **January 12, 2026:** Quantum Computing Inc.'s Chief Operating Officer reported routine equity transactions, including shares sold for tax. Also, an 8-K filing on January 12, 2026, detailed the signing of a Purchase Agreement on **January 11, 2026**, to acquire assets from Luminar Technologies for $22 million, subject to bankruptcy court approval.
*   **January 1, 2026:** Dr. Yuping Huang's appointment as Chief Executive Officer was confirmed, effective this date.
*   **January 6–9, 2026 (CES 2026):** QCi debuted live demonstrations at CES Foundry in Las Vegas, showcasing hands-on quantum photonics demos for route optimization, AI training acceleration, and financial-model exploration.

**SEALSQ Corp (LAES)**
*   **February 12, 2026:** SEALSQ Corp unveiled its strategic vision positioning embedded security and post-quantum cryptography (PQC) as foundational pillars of Physical Artificial Intelligence (AI). The company plans PQC-enabled secure microcontrollers, TPMs, chiplet HSMs, and an AI-native transactional layer called SEALCOIN.AI to secure machine interactions and transactions.
*   **February 11, 2026:** SEALSQ presented at Tech&Fest how its Quantum Shield QS7001 can be integrated as a Hardware Root of Trust to meet cryptographic transition legal requirements like CNSA 2.0.
*   **February 6, 2026:** SEALSQ stated that recent AI model advancements reinforce the need for SEALSQ-type post-quantum secure infrastructure, arguing that AI expands attack surfaces but doesn't change physics-based quantum threat drivers.
*   **February 4, 2026:** Carlos Moreira, CEO of SEALSQ, presented a sovereign root-to-quantum security platform at Tech&Fest.
*   **January 29, 2026:** SEALSQ announced France is consolidating its leading role in post-quantum semiconductors and European quantum sovereignty, with SEALSQ France reinforcing its presence with up to 200 staff across Toulouse, Aix-en-Provence, and Grenoble offices.
*   **January 26, 2026:** SEALSQ demonstrated a Post-Quantum Cryptography Robotic Concept using WISeRobot at the Physical AI Roundtable in Davos, illustrating the embedding of quantum-resistant algorithms into secure semiconductors.
*   **January 21, 2026:** SEALSQ signed a non-binding Memorandum of Understanding with the Government of Gujarat and Kaynes SemiCon to pursue India's first secure semiconductor design, test, and personalization center focused on post-quantum cryptography.
*   **January 15, 2026:** SEALSQ welcomed the official launch of the "Year of Quantum Security 2026" and confirmed active U.S. deployments of post-quantum semiconductor technology.
*   **January 14, 2026:** SEALSQ Corp filed a Form 6-K Report of foreign private issuer. The company also entered into a memorandum of understanding with Quobly for a potential phased investment.

*   **January 12, 2026:** Arqit Quantum Inc. filed a 6-K Report of foreign issuer.
*   **December 9, 2025:** Arqit Quantum Inc. filed its 20-F Annual and transition report of foreign private issuers.

**Aurora Innovation, Inc. (AUR)**

*   **February 12, 2026:** Aurora announced it has surpassed 250,000 driverless miles with zero collisions and introduced its second-generation hardware for fully autonomous trucking fleets.
*   **February 11, 2026:** Aurora released its fourth quarter and fiscal year ended December 31, 2025, financial results and hosted a business review conference call. The company detailed its 2025 loss and its 2026 driverless growth plan, projecting 2026 revenue of $14–$16 million and aiming to exit 2026 with over 200 driverless trucks in operation. Aurora also announced it is tripling its driverless network to 10 routes and preparing to expand across the U.S. Sun Belt with its latest software release. All of the company's commercial truck capacity is fully committed through the third quarter of 2026. Aurora filed its 10-K Annual Report and an 8-K Current Report with the SEC. The company also filed a SCHEDULE 13G/A.

**Tesla, Inc. (TSLA)**

*   **February 13, 2026:** Tesla will stop selling its Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology package after February 14 for the US market, and it will only be available as a monthly subscription thereafter. For Australia and New Zealand, FSD Supervised will only be a subscription offering for new car orders after **March 31, 2026**. Tesla is facing challenges with slowing electric vehicle (EV) deliveries, particularly in Europe, and is undergoing a strategic refresh of its global sales leadership. The company has effectively discontinued its Model S and Model X in 2026 to focus on the Model 3, Model Y, and Cybertruck, shifting its long-term focus towards artificial intelligence, robotics, and autonomous transport technologies.
*   **February 12, 2026:** Tesla software update version 2026.2.3 has been widely rolled out to the global vehicle fleet, including Cybertruck units, bringing new features such as a child left-alone warning, easier unlatching of the charge cable, and Supercharger maps improvement.
